Reviews.Title: “Basic, but would definately stay again.”
Reviews.Author: StuartPowell
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean, good view. 2 minute walk to the square. Perfect for someone wanting a cheap, easily located room.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was poor, 4th floor & very stuffy even with window open. Beds small & mattresses saggy. Location excellent. A bit overpriced for quality of room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: Andy P
Reviews.Content: Great value. I've been to Amsterdam several times. In fact, I've stayed at the Hotel Titus before. You can get the number 5 (and 1 I think) from Centraal Station to the Leidseplien which will be a 2min walk from the hotel. Being familiar with it all, we walked and it will take about 40mins from station to hotel. We got a shared twin room and it worked out something like Â£110 for two nights between two of us - so just over Â£25 per person per night. The location is great - just down the road from the Leidseplein and in walking distance for the shops, pubs, coffee shops, museums etc. If you couple a great location and a great price - something has to give, and it's the 'quality' of the room here that suffers - not in an overly bad way, but in terms of 'you get what you pay for'. Our room had a shower, a basin, we had clean towels, and a free of charge to use safe. We had a large window and a small TV. The room was large enough for the two beds and that's about it. The water was always hot, but unfortunately the downside means the room could get quite warm - not an issue due to the big window. The toilet was right outside, but shared, and small. The location was at the very top of the building and the stair climb was epic - not for the elderly, infirm, or drunk! If you only want a place to crash and will rarely be in the room other than to sleep, and you're happy with climbing steps - then this should be great! If you want somewhere that you can chill for an hour or two here and there, you may find it a bit uncomfortable as a relax-zone. If you're going with friends - make sure they're good friends as privacy in a room like that is non existent! There's also a free breakfast which like the hotel, is basic, but not exceptional - but gets the job done! :o) Happy Travelling!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Kolla_is
Reviews.Content: It is narrow! My husband needed help carrying our two inflight sized suitcases (weighting about 20 pounds- together) upstairs. And, of course, my husband is super strong. But those stairs to the 4th floor were narrow. And they were steep. But we made it. And we liked our room which was roomy. The bathroom was old but clean. The shower was ok, as we realized the first morning that the water was finished. The cold water too. But we had -10Â°C those days so maybe that is why. The man at the reception was friendly but could not help. Well, he is a receptionist, not a plumer i thought and went to enjoy a very nice, european style breakfast with 2 types of bread, cornflakes, milk, juices, butter, cheese, ham and boiled eggs. Jam, nutella and peanutbutter as well as excellent coffee. The location of Titus is perfect, you can walk anywhere in the down town area, many museums and sights are really close and the airport bus stop is just 5 minutes away. Of course, the hotel is a bit shabby and a little run down but as we only were there for 4 nights and just wanted a relaxed weekend trip to explore a city it was just about perfect. The stuff was nice and there is a really cheep vending machine in the breakfast room which came in handy.

Reviews.Title: “Low budget, good location, very very basic”
Reviews.Author: Geja H
Reviews.Content: The location is good. The room small and basic but the bed slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: PlutoUhuru
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as a group of 5. Comfortable beds and a big enough room, though we were in one of the basement rooms so we didn't have a room, though we didn't spend a great deal of time in the room anyway. The toilet was quite small and may have been better if there was another in the hotel as there were a number of us sharing that and the one shower. It was clean throughout our stay, and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: Ewa_Z
Reviews.Content: It's a budget place and as such has my vote - now and in the future. Our room was a bit worn down (and super-hot) and the bathroom was outside, but everything was clean and it was exactly the type of place you expect for a limited budget in Amsterdam. Has a nice hang our area and a kitchen where the breakfast is served. The building is the typical Amsterdam building - also a plus, unless you hate narrow staircases (in that case do not come to Holland at all). The location is great - a one-minute walk from Leidseplain, and the latter is the place where you want to spend your money, not the hotel. I

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Amy M
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly staff, gave us directions and information. Continental breakfast in the morning with cheese, meats, breads, eggs, cereals etc..great for the money paid. Room was fine, beds comfortable and toilet and shower just outside, stairs were quite steep, not really a problem for us 21 year olds tho Location was great central for everything Also checked out in the morning and staff did not have a problem with us leaving our luggage until we collected it evening time. Would definitely stay again for the money paid... Finally...if you have not experienced Amsterdam I highly reccomend you do so

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: medixsr
Reviews.Content: last minute sunday check in with tight budget and so after careful reviews and homework we opted to book here. But for the flight of the stairs you need to walk all is well. Over looking the river with a lovely view ( may not be from the room) and a stroll away to bus stops and canal cruise stops apart from the shopping street , what more you need. No smoking and no 'galatta's' ( noise ) of the red light area.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Coconuts_UK
Reviews.Content: 5 of us stayed here for 2 nights celebrating a friends birthday. We got the basement room which we all stayed in. It was a shared bathroom and toilet with a couple of other rooms which wasn't really a problem. As we were just below street level, it got slightly noisy if we had the windows open as could see peoples feet walking by etc but not really a problem! We paid such a low price and were literally looking for somewhere to crash out. The location is good, we walked into the centre and to Anne Franks house etc. Lots of places to eat and drink nearby. Friendly staff who answered all our questions. Great basic and comfortable place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pack Light...Stairs are a killer!”
Reviews.Author: Laura K
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful even though they laughed at us with our suitcases... we soon found out why! We were on the 3rd floor and talk about a steep climb, best take a back pack two girls with two heavily pack suitcases didn't go so well! Other that the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was basic, rooms were basic! Not a huge fan of sharing a bathroom but it was ok! Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Crampons, Rope and oxygen not supplied otherwise OK”
Reviews.Author: citydetective
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Titus with 6 male colleagues 16/17 September 2011 on a weekend trip to Amsterdam. The location is ideal very close to the busling Leidseplein and only 5 minutes by tram or 25 minutes walk to the Dam Sqaure area and main shopping/bar areas. This is definitly a budget Hotel and 55 euros per night for a weekend stay with breakfast in my view is good value. When we booked we read some damming reviews on Trip Advisor but what do you expect for 55 euros per night. My party was plesently surprised, we had a room for three and a room for four. Yes the rooms are sparsely furnished but were en suite with sattelite television with a wide choice of english channels. Yes the toilets smelt musty but so did my travelling companions at times. The single beds were adequate and the towels clean. Our party are all shapes and sizes and there were no complaints re the beds although perhaps they were too tired or drunk to notice. Cleaning was non exsistant during our weekend stay. The building and rooms are tired but so what. The room for three was on the fourth floor and residents had to climb four sets of stairs so steep that mountaineering skills would certainly have been an advantage. In fact all access to the upper floors was extremely steep and not for the less able or those with heavy rucksacks as the power of gravity may cause you to fall backward. The hotel is non smoking but there was some strange smells coming from teh firts floor one night on my return and it was not the bathrooms. I would stay there with friends but not my partner.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and expensive”
Reviews.Author: J K
Reviews.Content: Oh dear, where to start? The ONE positive thing about Titus is that it is in a good location â€“ just on the fringe of the Leidseplein and in walking distance of most attractions, with good canal and tram links to further destinations close by. However, other than its location, Titus has no other saving graces whatsoever. I travel to Amsterdam regularly, and this particular trip was a late-booked, 2 night stay on a Friday and Saturday night. As such, I just booked the absolute cheapest accommodation available (many hotels do not allow 2 night stays, especially on Fri/Sat, so choices were limited), but the Titus was not even particularly cheap! At approximately Â£80 per night (off-season) for appalling accommodation, Titus has got a good little money-making racket going on! Upon check-in, we had to pay a (refundable) deposit for our pillows. I mean, really? These werenâ€™t EXTRA pillows, but the very pillows (one each) that we had to sleep on. Iâ€™m used to paying deposits for TV remotes and such, but have never laid out 5Eur for a lumpy sack described as a â€˜pillowâ€™. Access to upstairs rooms is via extremely steep stairs, which even by Amsterdam standards were neck-breakingly steep. The stairway is dark, dingy, smelly, and doesnâ€™t feel especially safe, what with the holes in the wall and allâ€¦ The room itself (in our case a twin room) was pitiful. 2 x single beds more suited to toddlers than grown adults, with extremely hard bases, hard pillows, and prison-style, scratchy blankets for â€˜comfortâ€™. There was a broken mirror and sink, and the window faced a brick wall. Whilst the room had its own shower cubicle (clean-ish, spacious, OK), the toilet was situated on the hallway, to be shared with the rest of the floor. Fortunately, the toilet was situated right next to our room, so using it was no major inconvenience. Unfortunately, it was too filthy for words, stank to high heaven, and was situated in a â€˜roomâ€™ (cupboard) in which it was extremely difficult to close the door whilst going about your business. Sitting on the â€˜throneâ€™, my knees touched the back of the door, and Iâ€™m a 5â€™2â€� female! The size of the toilet was only a minor issue, though, the real problem was the aforementioned smell and dirt (think abundant poo-stains in the toilet bowl ALL of the time â€“ it had clearly been a long, long time since it was cleaned). The room rate included breakfast which wasâ€¦OK. I will not complain too much about breakfast, because it was an added bonus (it was the same price for room only, so our B&B rate made breakfast essentially free). The coffee and juice were nice, but the breakfast was a poor variation on â€˜continentalâ€™â€¦the usual stuff, a slice of ham, cheese, a bit of bread and a hard-boiled egg. Aside from the eggs being grey in colour (clearly not very fresh), it was edible and no ill effects ensued. Iâ€™d recommend this hotel to budget travellers only, perhaps a group of friends who just literally want a bed for the night and are none too fussed about hygiene and safety. If this room had been CHEAP, my review wouldâ€™ve been glowing. Problem is, itâ€™s more expensive than some much better hotels! Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fegarica
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. Reasonable price, especially if you are traveling with friends. Not far from city center. Good and free wifi for the lower rooms and lobby (1st and 2nd floor). I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: Penrhyn2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. On arrival at 3.30pm, the Hotel was locked and it took about 20 minutes of ringing the bell for someone to answer and we ended up waiting on the pavement with two other couples. Okay no big deal but not off to a good start. When we booked in we were asked if we wanted towels and remote control in our room. We said yes and were given two medium towels and the remote control. Thought this was odd as its billed as a hotel and not a hostel. We were in the accomodation next door, which was up very steep stairs, but then again thats Amsderdam for you. On the landing outside our room were two big sacks which I could only assume were dirty linen and they did not move until we checked out. Room was on first floor at the back which was quite dark. The room was very dilapidated, with thread bare carpet (complete with Iron Burn) and cheap furniture. Bathroom was adequate, more of a wet room. Breakfast room was bright and airy with a good continental breakfast, but room on the small side. Location was good, and hotel eay to find, we used the number 5 tram from Central Station. There was free Wi Fi and use of a computer in the breakfast room. Hotel was very noisy in the small hours of the morning with people returning from nights out, but then again Amsterdam is a bit of a party town. Our stay overall was very disapointing, which is a shame as I think with a few inexpensive touches, the rooms could be made to look a bit brighter with better quality furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Think Hostel would be better!”
Reviews.Author: Doyley17
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam and got the tram to hotel Titus, it is easy to get to and in a good location, within walking distance of tram stops and a 20-30 min walk to Dam square which is not so bad. The room was awful! We were in the room just by reception, a bit noisy but that was not the problem! There were 2 of the most uncomfortable beds which we had to push together as there was no double. The shower was fixed so we had to stand in the corner of the cubicle as it would not move, the toilet was in a seperate cubicle and neither of us could shut the door whilst we were sat on the loo!! The sink was in the bedroom and the cupboard consisted of 3 planks of wood nailed to the wall! The chap who booked us in asked if we wanted towels and then said they had run out and gave us 2 small towels to use! I expected basic but this was way way more 'basic' than I had imagined!! The breakfast was ok, the staff helpful, location good, just the room letting it down!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Freindly relaxed”
Reviews.Author: garygary1177
Reviews.Content: I arrived to a little hic up in room but it was sorted straight away staff very helpful with every request as it should be . I think staff make or break a Hotel the staff I meet were helpful and freindly VERY Good it is not a Five star Hotel but nor was the price I liked it .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from HELL. Do NOT stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Fthehoteltitus
Reviews.Content: Dirty, uncomfortable, unfriendly staff, and over priced. Charged us a deposit for TOWELS AND REMOTE CONTROL. One of the A**HOLES working there yelled at us for coming in late when we weren't even making any noise. We had an emergency and they wouldn't even let my friend who was staying in another room call or visit my room. This place was the absolute worst. There are other great hotels in Amsterdam for much less money, accommodating staff, and cleaner rooms with private bathrooms and showers. Try the Mozart Hotel. We were so relieved to stay there after staying at this hotel from hell. JUST DON'T GO HERE. Oh, and they over charged my credit card to top off our miserable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SateKajang
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Amsterdam last Mach. We stayed at Hotel Titus. Clean and very kind staff. The price was very reasonable and WORTH it. No complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome from hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireFiona
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently situated in a good area. The hotel is clean and fairly basic. The breakfast was very good. The staff are extremely helpful, friendly and polite. Yes, we will return and the stairs are part of the Amsterdam experience!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: hiboo
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the only single room available for 5 days and i would definitely recommend this hotel, very friendly staff, helpfull when the safe had a little problem they sorted it fast, sure the breakast could be bigger but my room was spotless, it was not noisy at all and i will go back there soon, 1 night receptionnist is probably the nicest person i met there, but all were very helpfull, it was warm , it was fiendly and next to leindesplein what more do you need, i cant speak for the bigger room but my 1 was great! For the price this is a bargain in amsterdam for a solo traveler

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: EasyyTimes
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews. For the price, this was the best value hotel that I stayed in during my month long tour of Europe. Pros: - Extremely cheap - I paid 50 Euro a night for a double room, which is about the price of a cheap hostel, let alone a hotel in such a great location. - FREE breakfast - The quality of the breakfast was unbelievable. Breakfast included fresh bread with a platter of ham and swiss cheese, a hard boiled egg, packaged jam/jelly, orange juice, and access to a lovely cappuccino machine. Possibly the best free breakfast you will ever eat. - FREE internet - There is a computer in the lobby which anyone staying in the hotel can use for free, as long as you don't stay on for too long. What a luxury. Every other hotel I stayed in charged you by the minute for internet access. - Great location - Located in one of the nicer parts of town, in the middle of the restaurant district, only a short walk away from the Van Gogh museum and the wonderful Vondelpark. Far, far away from the seedy red light district and the thieves that inhabit the region. For fans of coffee shops, it is a five minute walk to the best coffee shop in town, Easy Times, which has the highest quality product. Cons: - Quality of room - The beds were not very comfortable and the walls were very thin. But in one of the greatest late-night cities in the world, you shouldn't be spending much time in your room anyway. If you have trouble sleeping, go to Easy Times. - Bathroom - The toilet and shower are located in the hall. But the shower is spacious and hot water is not a problem. Overall, 50 euro a night for a double room with high quality breakfast is one of the best deals you will find anywhere. Sure the rooms aren't the best, but it is in a great, safe location and for that price what do you expect? For people that don't mind staying in a 1-star hotel, this is truly a hidden gem. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “titus hotel”
Reviews.Author: boydy
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Titus in Amsterdam and to sum it all up it was dreadful! Where do i start, stinking, toilets, showers, room, paint hanging off ceilings, un-professional staff! We stayed in room no.1 which is right beside the shared toilet, due to there being about an inch gap between the doors and frames all we could smell was sh1t in our room! We were kept up allnight by people shouting and toilets flushing! When me and a friend called into the food area for a glass of water we were made share the same glass as they only had one large glass in the whole place! omg how disgraceful is that for a hotel! I called in reception to ask for a cup of warm water to be told could i wait as the person was playing on-line poker, after waiting he asked could he bring it down to my room in ten mins, where it never appeared.........AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Avoid this terrible hostel”
Reviews.Author: norextra
Reviews.Content: The location is the only positive word I can say about this hell hole. Went to this place in May 2009 together with 8 friends, and are certainly never coming back. Rooms: Was situated in the basement. Consisted of 4 beds and a sink. Beds were way too soft and full of bedbugs. One toilet in a tiny room (if you sit down you cannot close the door) in the hall, this one was shared by all guests (15-20). One shower in a similar tiny room, also shared by all guests. All rooms were infested with mold and fungus. Terrible. Staff: The staff was in the same condition as the rooms. Breakfast: Did not dare to try it. Certainly not a hotel, and should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again - A nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: emerald_starcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in July. On arrival of the 'hotel' -it was more a hostel- the receptionists were friendly. We were given a key and told where our room was. When we booked the room we were aware that the room was a basement room however on entering the room our thoughts were 'Oh my god!'. The room was dirty with stains on the walls and paint peeling off. The toilet was right next door to our room so we were woken up constantly with people flushing the toilet in the night. Also the toilet was very small and whilst sitting on it my legs touched the door - I'm only 5'5". The shower room was next door to the toilet, the shower room smelt of damp and was very claustophobic with no window. Sleeping at night was impossible during the 5 night stay. This was due to the amount of noisy groups of teenagers staying in the dorms who did not respect that some people due actually sleep at night. We got most of our sleep in the afternoons. The breakfast consisted of a basket of bread and eggs with cheese and salami. The meat and cheese was curling at the edges so obviously wasn't very fresh. The staff were friendly with the exception of one on our last night. Because we were leaving early in the morning we wanted to check out the night before as reception didn't open til 7. Anyway the woman in question tutted as us when we asked to checkout as she was more interested in playing on the computer in the lounge area. She was very abrupt with us and barely spoke. We wouldn't stay at the Titus again as it was a nightmare 5 nights. Maybe it would be OK if you were a teenager who wanted to non-stop party but if you want to sleep at night then don't go to the Titus.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Webber25
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from staying at the Titus Hotel, went with a large group and stayed in the quad rooms - for the price you pay you cant ask for much more, rooms were clean and tidy, there were sockets for hairdryers/straighteners - which believe it or not some cheap hotels dont provide and there is no curfew - which again some other hotels do have curfews Really close the Leidseplein Sq - literally 2mins walk and close to Trams that take you into Dam Central - yes the stairs are narrow, was on the 3rd floor so you do have to be careful - especially after a few!! but that is not a negative as most hotels in the area have the same layout. Breakfast was basic but edible, hotel staff were friendly and accomodating If your looking for 5* luxury then this is obviously not for you - if your looking for a no frills place to stay that is clean, friendly and a good location then I would thoroughly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, NIce Location, Clean, Very Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Swoodhall
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I stayed here in a quadruple room, for a summer weekend in Amsterdam, as we were attending a huge party down in the Amsterdam arena. We found the hotel Titus to be great for the price we paid. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 2nd floor, the stairs were very steep but it is expected in the old Dutch narrow houses in Amsterdam. The room was a fair size, was clean had a nice bay window that overlooked the canal, the Bathroom was also clean. The hotels location was excellent, it is only 5mins away from Leidseplein.

Reviews.Title: “Most foul”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdamaged
Reviews.Content: Dark, seedy, dirty, stinking & overpriced. Ok if you want to lock yourself in a room and take hallucinogenics for a weekend as the telly works OK. This place has had no maintenance work done of any description for AT LEAST 20 years. I wouldn't give this place any stars at all, it's disgusting. For the same money you can stay further into the center of Amsterdam and have a much nicer room. Shop around. This place is unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “OK...ish”
Reviews.Author: ErikG
Reviews.Content: Well the Hotel was simple and basic. Our room was on the top floor and you got there via three flights of very steep stairs... not for the faint hearted! we had an 'en-suit' which was tiny and in need of a good re-fit. Position was good for getting around BUT I would not stay there again when I return to Amsterdam... think that says it all.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: catscradle
Reviews.Content: After the initial shock of the stairs- steep doesn't begin to describe them and the general shabbiness of the rooms, we found this to be a good base for exploring the city. The showers were hot and powerful, beds comfy, TV worked and the staff were more than helpful and very friendly and warm. Security was good and the breakfasts lovely. Beware of booking if you have weight issues as the toilets were just big enough to use comfortably. Luckily we are all fairly slim!

Reviews.Title: “gone downhill more like downmounatin..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i first discovered the hotel titus, by chance, about 6 years ago before the invention of [-------------------]and so on. three friends and i stayed there for a long weekend and it was a gem. the rooms were basic but clean and well maintained, the service was good and personal, the hotel was centrally located but we still had a balcony that looked over quiet canal. a real gem and good enough that we stayed in the same room (21) for the next four years. after a bit fo a break, i returned last june and what a transformation. i beleive the management had changed and the hotel had adopted all that is bad about hotels in amsterdam. - used the conversion to euros as an excuse to charge disgraceful rates for 1 one star hotel - the hotel had not been maintained with ripped sheets, holes in the plaster and radiators hanging off the walls - cleaners not even touching your room during the day - front desk staff inattentive this hotel used to be a gem and they've gone and spoilt it - why are some people so short sighted? they've lost my business and i used to recommend the place to 5 - 6 people a year. no more

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Titus
HotelInfo.Address: Leidsekade 74, Amsterdam 1017 PM, The Netherlands
